page.title: 19The Army at Deepcut
page.content: The Royal Army Ordnance Corps (RAOC) headquarters is in Deepcut and it owns about 2 square kilometres of land in the area. One half of the land has houses for families and the other half has offices and the training ground. The RAOC started in the Crimean War and was called the Military Store Department. In the Crimean War there were not enough supplies so they organised them. Our school is just to the east of the married quarters and many of the children have parents in the army but some come from Deepcut village. On Friday 17th May 1985 the RAOC were given the freedom of the Borough of Surrey Heath and all the children in our school went to watch the ceremony.
